page.title: 13Then & Now- life in 1925 (1)
page.content: {Mrs Hobbs,aged 78, was interviewed {by children from South Brent Primary {School, using a tape recorder. Their {questions and her replies were: { {What sort of clothes did you wear in {1925? It wasn't anything very different to what we wear now. The skirt came just below the knee not above the knee. Hats- hats were straw hats, mostly brown and we always mostly had ribbons on them to decorate them. Not really old-fashioned. Shoes were very similar to what we wear today; of course going back another ten years it would be nailed boots and button-up shoes- quite old- fashioned. {What did old people wear in 1925?
